segment.source: This page describes the Open Publishing workflow in use by the WDG Partner & ITPro CPub team.
segment.target: This page describes the Open Publishing workflow in use by the WDG Partner & ITPro CPub team.

segment.source: It is based on GitHub Flow, as described by Scott Chacon.
segment.target: It is based on GitHub Flow, as described by Scott Chacon.

segment.source: The golden rule of the workflow is that anything in the master branch is deployable.
segment.target: The golden rule of the workflow is that anything in the master branch is deployable.

segment.source: To make the changes on the GitHub site:
segment.target: To make the changes on the GitHub site:

segment.source: Open the file you want to change and click the pencil icon to enter edit mode.
segment.target: Open the file you want to change and click the pencil icon to enter edit mode.

segment.source: When you're done, scroll to the bottom of the page and choose Create a new branch.
segment.target: When you're done, scroll to the bottom of the page and choose Create a new branch.

segment.source: Change the name of the new branch, if you like.
segment.target: Change the name of the new branch, if you like.

segment.source: At this point, you can continue adding more changes to your new branch, or you can immediately submit a pull request.
segment.target: At this point, you can continue adding more changes to your new branch, or you can immediately submit a pull request.

segment.source: To make the changes in a local clone, use the following steps:
segment.target: To make the changes in a local clone, use the following steps:

segment.source: To work on something new, create a descriptively named branch off of master (ie: enterprise-wdk):
segment.target: To work on something new, create a descriptively named branch off of master (ie: enterprise-wdk):

segment.source: Commit to that branch locally and regularly push your work to the same named branch on the server.
segment.target: Commit to that branch locally and regularly push your work to the same named branch on the server.

segment.source: Iterate with others (tech review, edit) in your branch.
segment.target: Iterate with others (tech review, edit) in your branch.

segment.source: When the branch is ready to publish, open a pull request.
segment.target: When the branch is ready to publish, open a pull request.

segment.source: A peer or admin repo reviews the changes and merges the content into master.
segment.target: A peer or admin repo reviews the changes and merges the content into master.

segment.source: Once it is in master, a repo admin may deploy to the live branch at any time.
segment.target: Once it is in master, a repo admin may deploy to the live branch at any time.
